MINUTES OF THE SITTING OF 6 JULY 2011 IN THE CHAIR: Jerzy BUZEK President 1. Opening of the sitting The sitting opened at 9.05. 2. Programme of activities of the Polish presidency of the Council (debate) Council and Commission statements: Programme of activities of the Polish presidency of the Council Donald Tusk (President-in-Office of the Council) and José Manuel Barroso (President of the Commission) made the statements. The following spoke: Joseph Daul, on behalf of the PPE Group, Martin Schulz, on behalf of the S&D Group, Guy Verhofstadt, on behalf of the ALDE Group, Ryszard Antoni Legutko, on behalf of the ECR Group, Rebecca Harms, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, Lothar Bisky, on behalf of the GUE/NGL Group, Nigel Farage, on behalf of the EFD Group, who also replied to a blue-card question by Robert Goebbels, Frank Vanhecke, Non-attached Member, Jacek Saryusz-Wolski, Bogusław Liberadzki, Alexander Graf Lambsdorff, Paweł Robert Kowal, José Bové, Niki Tzavela, Nicole Sinclaire, Markus Ferber, who also replied to a blue- card question by William (The Earl of) Dartmouth, Marita Ulvskog, Marielle De Sarnez, Zbigniew Ziobro, who also replied to a blue-card question by Marek Siwiec, Oriol Junqueras Vies, Barry Madlener, who also replied to a blue-card question by Michał Tomasz Kamiński and who objected to comments made off- microphone by Martin Schulz, who justified his comments, Mario Mauro, Rovana Plumb, Michał Tomasz Kamiński, who also replied to a blue-card question by Zbigniew Ziobro, Arnaud Danjean, Luis Manuel Capoulas Santos, Paulo Rangel, Ivailo Kalfin, Jan Olbrycht, Marek Siwiec, Danuta Maria Hübner, Leonardo Domenici, Czesław Adam Siekierski and Jacek Protasiewicz, who also replied to a blue-card question by Marek Henryk Migalski. The following spoke under the ‘catch-the-eye’ procedure: Ádám Kósa, Wojciech Michał Olejniczak, Jacek Olgierd Kurski, Jaroslav Paška, Angelika Werthmann, Monika Flašíková Beňová and Tunne Kelam. The following spoke: José Manuel Barroso and Donald Tusk. The following spoke: Barry Madlener, making a personal statement in response to Martin Schulz’s previous speech, and Martin Schulz to explain what he had said. The debate closed. IN THE CHAIR: Gianni PITTELLA Vice-President 3. Financial, economic and social crisis: measures and initiatives to be taken (debate) Report on the financial, economic and social crisis: recommendations concerning the measures and initiatives to be taken [2010/2242(INI)] – Special Committee on the Financial, Economic and Social Crisis. Rapporteur: Pervenche Berès (A7-0228/2011) Pervenche Berès introduced the report. The following spoke: Jan Vincent-Rostowski (President-in-Office of the Council) and Olli Rehn (Member of the Commission). EN 4.10.2011 Official Journal of the European Union C 291 E/163 Wednesday 6 July 2011

The following spoke: Othmar Karas, on behalf of the PPE Group, Sergio Gaetano Cofferati, on behalf of the S&D Group, Olle Schmidt, on behalf of the ALDE Group, Kay Swinburne, on behalf of the ECR Group, Pascal Canfin, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, Nikolaos Chountis, on behalf of the GUE/NGL Group, Mario Borghezio, on behalf of the EFD Group, Hans-Peter Martin, Non-attached Member, Sirpa Pietikäinen, Hannes Swoboda, Wolf Klinz, Roberts Zīle, Patrick Le Hyaric, Rolandas Paksas, Marine Le Pen, Frank Engel, Patrizia Toia, Sylvie Goulard, Ilda Figueiredo, Iliana Ivanova, Anni Podimata, Burkhard Balz, Liisa Jaakonsaari, Regina Bastos, Kinga Göncz, Iuliu Winkler, Antolín Sánchez Presedo, Vito Bonsignore, Elisa Ferreira, Krišjānis Kariņš, Monika Hohlmeier, Bendt Bendtsen and Thomas Mann. The following spoke under the ‘catch-the-eye’ procedure: Miroslav Mikolášik. The following spoke: Robert Atkins on the organisation of the debates. The following spoke under the ‘catch-the-eye’ procedure: Ana Gomes and Alfreds Rubiks. The following spoke: Olli Rehn and Ludwik Kotecki (President-in-Office of the Council). (Continuation of the debate, see: minutes of 6.7.2011, item 5 ) 4. Welcome On behalf of Parliament, the President welcomed Muhammad Yunus, awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2006, who had taken a seat in the distinguished visitors’ gallery. 5. Financial, economic and social crisis: measures and initiatives to be taken (continuation of debate) (For the title of the report see minutes of 6.7.2011, item 3 ) The following spoke: Pervenche Berès (rapporteur). IN THE CHAIR: Roberta ANGELILLI Vice-President The debate closed. Vote: minutes of 6.7.2011, item 6.11 . 6. Voting time Detailed voting results (amendments, separate and split votes, etc.) appear in the Results of Votes annex to the minutes. The results of roll-call votes are available in electronic form only, as an annex to the minutes, and can be accessed via Europarl. * * * The following spoke: Sajjad Karim on racist attacks against him and his family. EN C 291 E/164 Official Journal of the European Union 4.10.2011 Wednesday 6 July 2011

Corrections to votes and voting intentions Corrections to votes and voting intentions appear on the ‘Séance en direct’ website under ‘Votes’/‘Results of votes’/‘Roll-call votes’. They are published in hard copy in the Result of roll-call votes annex. The electronic version on Europarl will be regularly updated for a maximum of two weeks after the day of the vote concerned. After the two-week deadline has passed, the list of corrections to votes and voting intentions will be finalised so that it can be translated and published in the Official Journal. (The sitting was suspended at 14.55 and resumed at 15.05.) IN THE CHAIR: Edward McMILLAN-SCOTT Vice-President 9. Approval of the minutes of the previous sitting Estelle Grelier had made it known that she had been present but that her name was not on the attendance register. The minutes of the previous sitting were approved. 10.
